data.question: What is the empirical formula and formula weight for BTB-MOF-24?
What crystal system and space group does BTB-MOF-24 belong to?
data.answer: Crystal system: Monoclinic, Space group: P21/c

data.question: What are the unit cell dimensions for BTB-MOF-24?
What is the CCDC number for BTB-MOF-24?
What is the soaking time and sample amount used for the adsorption experiment of n-heptane in BTB-MOF-24?
data.answer: Soaking time: 90 minutes, Sample amount: 4 μL

data.question: What is the method used for the structural solving of guest-containing BTB-MOF-24?
data.answer: The structures were solved using CrysAlisPro software with direct structure solving employing the intrinsic phase method, followed by refinement using the SHELX-2013 program package.

data.question: What analytical techniques were used for the characterization of BTB-MOF-24?
data.answer: Analytical techniques include single crystal X-ray diffraction, powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), and Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy.

data.question: How was the chiral analysis for sites AS and AR in BTB-MOF-24 conducted?
data.answer: Chiral analysis involved isolating the 3D structures of sites AS and AR, generating a mirror image of site AR (termed AR*), and overlapping the structures to confirm the existence of chirality in these adsorption sites.

data.question: What was the result of the chiral analysis for sites AS and AR in BTB-MOF-24?
data.answer: The chiral analysis confirmed the existence of chirality in the adsorption sites AS and AR, as the perfect overlapping between sites AR* and AS indicated no distortion of site AR caused by the immobilizing of (-)-citronellal in site AS.

data.question: What was the purpose of using BTB-MOF-24 in the study?
data.answer: BTB-MOF-24 was used as a novel crystalline template for the structural determination of flexible chain compounds of nanoscale length, including the determination of absolute configuration of chiral compounds.
